# Arpeggio: Dominant 7#5 in A

## Brief Presentation
The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio in A is a collection of notes that outline the sound of a dominant 7th chord with a raised 5th interval. This arpeggio is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and other experimental music genres to add tension and color to chord progressions.

## Notes and Intervals
The notes in the Dominant 7#5 arpeggio in A are A (root), C# (major 3rd), E# (raised 5th), and G (minor 7th). The intervals in this arpeggio are a major 3rd between A and C#, an augmented 5th between A and E#, and a minor 3rd between C# and E#, as well as a minor 3rd between E# and G. 

## Genre and Flavor
This arpeggio is often used in genres like jazz and fusion to create tension and dissonance in chord progressions. The raised 5th interval adds a unique flavor to the sound, giving it a more complex and edgy quality compared to a regular dominant 7th arpeggio. When used tastefully, this arpeggio can bring a sense of unpredictability and excitement to a musical piece.
